TM 2.0RC1 Testing
installation : eclipse-SDK-3.3M7
RSE install  : I20070524-0915
java.runtime : Sun 1.5.0_11-b03
os.name:     : Windows XP, Service Pack 2
------------------------------------------------
I've put in a fix here such that the default input is ISystemRegistryUI rather than ISystemRegistry.

The NPE is gone, but when you click on the table the table is empty.  Also if you click Show in Table on Local and use the Move Selected Resource Up One Level button on the toolbar it shows you an empty table instead of showing all the connections.
Reopening as NPE is gone, but the table is now blank instead of displaying all the connections.  I got the same results using the latest source.

Created an attachment (id=69124)
Fixed 2 places where SystemRegistry was used when SystemRegistryUI should of been used.

Changed SystemViewConnectionAdapter.getParent() to return SystemRegistryUI instead of SystemRegistry.   Also changed SystemTableViewPart.setFocus() to setInput to SystemRegistryUI instead of SystemRegistry.

In this patch is an additional fix that will make sure the Up button is disabled when there is no parent.

Legal Message: I, Kevin Doyle, declare that I developed attached code from
scratch, without referencing any 3rd party materials except material licensed
under the EPL. I am authorized by my employer, IBM Canada Ltd. to make this
contribution under the EPL.
Martin, do you approve of me putting in this patch?

The other change was just moving 2 lines outside of the original if and setting _parent = null, as it was never doing setEnabled(false) because null is not an instanceof IAdaptable.

Martin, should I change the patch to make it look the way you said?
Never mind. I modified and applied it.
